_header: Alas alas that I was born
Note: Includes former 141.5; for another version in Fasciculus morum, see 264; cf. 2027, 6216.
Subjects: sinner, lament of; sermons, verse in
_description: The Sinner’s Lament, a tag in the Fasciculus morum, Version B

Bod187.Transcription:
Alas alas þat y was bornBoþe body & sowle y em for
                    lorn

Bod410.Transcription:
Alas Alas þat I was bornBoth lyf & sowle I am for
                    lorn

BodLauMis568.Transcription:
Alas alas þat y was bornboþe lyfe and sale I am for
                    lorne

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornBoþe lyf & sowle y am for
                    lorn
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 187.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Allas allas þat I was borneboth lyue & soule I am for
                    lorne

CamGon364.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornbothe lyf and soule I am for
                    lorne

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornbot lyf and saul I ame
                    forlorne

CantLitD14.Transcription:
Allas allas þat i was borneboth life & soule i am for
                    lorne
CantLitD14.Note: Written as prose with a ‘Nota’ in the margin.

DULCosViv2.Transcription:
Alas alas þat I was bornboth lyue & saule I am for
                    lorne

Eton34.Transcription:
Alas Alas þat I was bornBothe lyfe & sowle I am
                    forlorn
Eton34.Note:
Written as prose; f. 161v of continuous
                    foliation.

Lam78.Transcription: Alas alas that I was bornbothe lyf ant saule I am for lorn
Lam78.Note: Copied from Fasciculus. Written as prose.

Lincoln234.Transcription:
Alas alas þat euer I was bornffor body and soule I am for
                    lorn
Lincoln234.Note:
Not in the Fasciculus morum, but occurring in a treatise on the
                    Ten Commandments, in portion on the Fifth Commandment, telling story of a sinner
                    who cried this out to his confessor.
Lincoln234.Editions:
Owst,  Gerald Robert. 
             Preaching in Medieval England.
         Cambridge: UP, 1926; rev. ed. New York, 1961: 273.

Spalding.Transcription: Ala[ ] allace that I was bornelyfe and soule I am forlorne

WorcF19.Transcription:
Alas alas þat y was borynBoth lyf & saule I am for
                    loryn

WorcQ3.Transcription:
Allas allas þat I was borneboþe lyf & saul I haue
                    lorne
